title: Border, late 18th–early 19th century
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Border of Point d'Alençon with a design of "semé de larmes" – a pattern of dots and leaves powdered over the ground. Edging is a narrow garland of ribbon and sprays. Fond: brides tortillée. Modes: réseau mouché, enchainettes, point mignon. Pattern outlined with cordonnet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Border, late 18th–early 19th century.
late 18th–early 19th century. Medium: linen
Technique: needle lace. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-248.
